sap.ui.mdc.base.FilterOperatorConfig.!description: Configuration of model-specific filter operators depending on data types.

)

getMatchingOperators.!description: Returns the possible operators for the given type and (if given) value.

parameters.sValue: type: string, description: the value entered so far

getDefaultOperator.!description: Returns the default operator for the given type

parameters.vType: type: string|sap.ui.model.SimpleType, description: a type or its name

getOperatorsForType.!description: Returns all available operators for the given type; see FilterOperatorConfig.getOperators()

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.mdc.base.FilterOperatorConfig with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.base.Object.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to sap.ui.core.ElementMetadata
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

addOperatorsToType.!description: Adds one or more operator(s) (given by name or array of names) to the given type

sap.ui.mdc.base.FilterOperatorConfig.!helpDescription: Configuration of model-specific filter operators depending on data types.

getFor.!description: Returns the FilterOperatorConfig for a specific model instance (and creates it lazily if required).

parameters.oModel: type: undefined, description: the model for which the filter operator configuration is requested

registerFor.!description: Registers a certain type of FilterOperatorConfig for the given model type. When someone requests the FilterOperatorConfig for a model of the given type, an instance of the config will be created and assigned to the model instance. This method may only be called by the model whose type is given as first parameter sModelClassName.

parameters.sModelClassName: type: string, description: the name of the model class for which the given config should be used
parameters.oFOC: type: object, description: the FilterOperatorConfig class (not an instance) to be used for the given model type

sap.ui.mdc.base.state.SelectOption.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new SelectOption. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getPropertyName propertyName} : string
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

setPropertyName.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getPropertyName propertyName}. Name of property When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sPropertyName: type: string, description: New value for property propertyName

getPropertyName.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getPropertyName propertyName}.

Name of property

sap.ui.mdc.base.ConditionModelPropertyBi.!constructorDescription:
Creates a new ConditionModelPropertyBinding.

This constructor should only be called by subclasses or model implementations, not by application or control code.
Such code should use {@link sap.ui.mdc.base.ConditionModel#bindProperty ConditionModel#bindProperty} on the corresponding model instance instead.

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). See {@link sap.ui.core.RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData} for details.

blocked.!description: Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busyIndicatorSize.!description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

width.!description: Width of the VerticalLayout. If no width is set, the width of the content is used. If the content of the layout has a larger width than the layout, it is cut off. There is no scrolling inside the layout.

enabled.!description: If not enabled, all controls inside are not enabled automatically.

sap.ui.mdc.base.ConditionModel.!description: JSON based Model for sap.ui.mdc.base.FilterField controls. The model stores the entered values as condition objects and applies the conditions to the ListBinding of e.g. a table.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.mdc.base.ConditionModel.

createCondition.!description:
Deprecated! Since undefined use the sap.ui.mdc.base.Condition.createCondition
creates a condition instance for the condition model
createCondition.!type: fn(sFieldPath: String, sOperator: String, aValues: [Object]) -> Object

parameters.sOperator: type: string, description: the operator for the condition
parameters.aValues: type: any[], description: the array of values for the condition
parameters.sFieldPath: type: string, description: the fieldPath name of the condition

getConditions.!description: Returns conditions for a specified FieldPath.

parameters.sFieldPath: type: string, description: fieldPath of the condition

addCondition.!description: Adds a condition for a specified FieldPath.
addCondition.!type: fn(sFieldPath: String, oCondition: Object, bForce: Boolean) -> sap.ui.mdc.base.ConditionModel

parameters.bForce: type: boolean, description: if set the condition will be added even if it already exist
parameters.sFieldPath: type: string, description: fieldPath of the condition
parameters.oCondition: type: object, description: condition to be added

createItemCondition.!description:
Deprecated! Since undefined use the sap.ui.mdc.base.Condition.createItemCondition
creates a condition instance for the Item condition
createItemCondition.!type: fn(sFieldPath: String, sKey: String, sDescription: String) -> Object

parameters.sDescription: type: string, description: the description of the operator
parameters.sKey: type: string, description: the operator for the condition
parameters.sFieldPath: type: string, description: the fieldPath name of the condition
type: string, description: fieldPath of the condition

parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

removeCondition.!description: Removes a condition for a specified FieldPath.
removeCondition.!type: fn(sFieldPath: String, vCondition: Number | Object) -> Boolean

parameters.vCondition: type: int|object, description: condition or index of the condition
parameters.sFieldPath: type: string, description: fieldPath of the condition

setConditions.!description: Sets conditions. All already existing conditions will be removed

parameters.oConditions: type: object, description: object of conditions for corresponding fieldPaths

sap.ui.mdc.base.ConditionModel.!helpDescription: JSON based Model for sap.ui.mdc.base.FilterField controls. The model stores the entered values as condition objects and applies the conditions to the ListBinding of e.g. a table.

insertCondition.!description: Inserts a condition for a specified FieldPath.
insertCondition.!type: fn(sFieldPath: String, iIndex: Number, oCondition: Object, bForce: Boolean) -> sap.ui.mdc.base.ConditionModel

parameters.bForce: type: boolean, description: if set the condition will be inserted even if it already exist
parameters.sFieldPath: type: string, description: fieldPath of the condition
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: index where the condition should be inserted
parameters.oCondition: type: object, description: condition to be inserted

merge.!description: merge conditions from the source conditionModel into this instance
merge.!type: fn(sFieldPath: String, oCM: ConditionModel, sSourceFieldPath: String)

parameters.sSourceFieldPath: type: string, description: specifies which conditions from the source should be merged.
parameters.sFieldPath: type: string, description: specifies which conditions should be removed and replaced by the conditions from the source ConditionModel

clone.!description: creates a clone of the ConditionModel which contains the conditions for the sFieldPath

parameters.sFieldPath: type: string, description: specifies which conditions should be copied into the clone. If not specified all conditions will be copied.

indexOf.!description: Determines the index of a condition for a specified FieldPath.

parameters.sFieldPath: type: string, description: fieldPath of the condition
parameters.oCondition: type: object, description: condition to be searched

removeAllConditions.!description: Removes all conditions for a specified FieldPath.

parameters.sFieldPath: type: string, description: fieldPath of the condition

sap.ui.mdc.base.state.UiState.!description: Creates a new instance of an UiState class.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.mdc.base.state.UiState.

removeAllSelectOptions.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getSelectOptions selectOptions}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

indexOfSelectOption.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.mdc.base.state.SelectOption in the aggregation {@link #getSelectOptions selectOptions}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oSelectOption: type: sap.ui.mdc.base.state.SelectOption, description: The selectOption whose index is looked for

getSelectOptions.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getSelectOptions selectOptions}.

Select Options

destroySelectOptions.!description: Destroys all the selectOptions in the aggregation {@link #getSelectOptions selectOptions}.

addSelectOption.!description: Adds some selectOption to the aggregation {@link #getSelectOptions selectOptions}.

parameters.oSelectOption: type: sap.ui.mdc.base.state.SelectOption, description: The selectOption to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.mdc.base.state.UiState with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to sap.ui.core.ElementMetadata
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

sap.ui.mdc.base.state.UiState.!constructorDescription:
Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSelectOptions selectOptions} : sap.ui.mdc.base.state.SelectOption[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.base.state.UiState.!helpDescription: Creates a new instance of an UiState class.

insertSelectOption.!description: Inserts a selectOption into the aggregation {@link #getSelectOptions selectOptions}.

parameters.oSelectOption: type: sap.ui.mdc.base.state.SelectOption, description: The selectOption to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the selectOption should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the selectOption is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the selectOption is inserted at the last position

removeSelectOption.!description: Removes a selectOption from the aggregation {@link #getSelectOptions selectOptions}.

parameters.vSelectOption: type: int|string|sap.ui.mdc.base.state.SelectOption, description: The selectOption to remove or its index or id
